title: David Oyelowo will play the President in Showtime's The President Is Missing
text:
The President Of the United States has been found for Showtime's upcoming adaptation of The President is Missing.

Showtime announced on Tuesday that David Oyelowo has signed on to star as The President in the series, based on the novel of the same name by iconic author James Patterson and the 42nd President of the United States, Bill Clinton.

The network has issued a pilot order for The President is Missing, which will be written by Anthony Peckham (Invictus, Sherlock Holmes).

New president: The President Of the United States has been found for Showtime's upcoming adaptation of The President is Missing, with David Oyelowo taking the role

The President Is Missing follows Oyelowo's character, who begins the story as the politically inept Vice President and unexpectedly becomes the President halfway through the first term.

The President is suddenly attacked from all sides as he finds himself in the middle of a world-threatening crisis as he must choose whether to stay the course and toe the party line, or stand up for his beliefs.

The novel by Patterson and Clinton was the top-selling novel of 2018, selling over 2.3 million copies in North America alone.

James and Bill: The President Is Missing follows Oyelowo's character, who begins the story as the politically inept Vice President and unexpectedly becomes the President halfway through the first term

The rights to the book were actually sold to Showtime back in September 2017, with Deadline reporting the cable network won a hotly-contested bidding war.

Patterson and Clinton shopped the book around to 16 different film studios, networks and streaming platforms before Showtime won the rights.

'David brings such enormous depth, sensitivity and power to every role he plays,' said Gary Levine, co-president of entertainment for Showtime in a statement.

Depth: 'David brings such enormous depth, sensitivity and power to every role he plays,' said Gary Levine, co-president of entertainment for Showtime in a statement

'Having him as our lead ensures that our series will have the exhilarating suspense of a political thriller along with the juicy complexity of a character drama,' he added.

Peckham will write the pilot script while also serving as an executive producer alongside Christopher McQuarrie (Mission: Impossible - Fallout) and Heather McQuarrie.

Oyelowo is also serving as executive producer alongside Patterson, Clinton and Leopoldo Gout.

Oyelowo most recently starred in Don't Let Go with Brian Tyree Henry, Alfred Molina and Storm Reid.

He is also part of the all-star cast of Chaos Walking, alongside Tom Holland, Daisy Ridley, Nick Jonas and Cynthia Erivo.

The actor also stars in Come Away alongside Angelina Jolie and Michael Caine, which is arriving next year.
